Merged pull request "Add sqlite3 package to Debian/Ubuntu dependencies" (#1276) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The `sqlite3` command is used by build-tools/mono-runtimes/mono-runtimes.targets
during the build and is thus a hard dependency.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Normalize paths passed to api-merge" (#1278) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Depending on whether api-merge is invoked by xbuild or msbuild, the paths passed
to the app can be relative, full or mixed. However, the code assumes that
they're all equal and compares them to know when to stop processing the passed
sources.

Since the assumption is wrong and it breaks our builds, this patch makes sure
that all paths are normalized before they are compared.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Normalize paths passed to api-merge" (#1278) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Depending on whether api-merge is invoked by xbuild or msbuild, the paths passed
to the app can be relative, full or mixed. However, the code assumes that
they're all equal and compares them to know when to stop processing the passed
sources.

Since the assumption is wrong and it breaks our builds, this patch makes sure
that all paths are normalized before they are compared.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "async void OnCreate not reporting errors on API 15/16" (#1277) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use this sample code:
       
        public class MyActivity : AppCompatActivity
        {
           protected override async void OnCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
           {
                base.OnCreate(savedInstanceState);
                throw new Exception();
           }
        }
2. Run the app and open the activity on API 15 or 16
3. The exception is ignored, app continues running
4. when removing the word ``async``, the exception gets reported, app crashes.

### Expected Behavior
App should crash no matter whether it is ``async void`` or just ``void``, especially if the exception is thrown before any ``await``.
### Actual Behavior
On API 15 and 16, it only crashes if it is ``void``. On android M and others, it crashes with both ``async void`` and ``void``.
### Version Information

during the build and is thus a hard dependency.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[macOS] TapGesture assigned on a parent blocks children input (Picker‚Ä¶" (#1822) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
‚Ä¶) from receiving input.

### Description of Change ###

Assigning a TapGesture to a parent layout will cause the children to not receive input from the mouse. You can for instance drag on a picker's button but it will not open normally by clicking.

The idea is to probe it instead of blocking it.

### Bugs Fixed ###

https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/1821

### API Changes ###

None.

### Behavioral Changes ###

None.

### PR Checklist ###

- [x] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [x] Rebased on top of master at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [x] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "* [macOS] TapGesture assigned on a parent blocks children input controls (Picker) from receiving input." (#1821) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
Assigning a TapGesture to a parent layout will cause the children to not receive input from the mouse.  You can for instance drag on a picker's button but it will not open normally by clicking.

The idea is to probe it instead of blocking it.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add Grid
2. Assign TapGesture of one to Grid.
3. Place multiple controls inside including a picker with data.
4. Click on the drop down button.  It wont receive the click.

### Expected Behavior
All input controls should respond to the click.

### Actual Behavior
Some input controls will ignore the click.

### Basic Information

- Last known good version: None.
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac.
- Platform Target Frameworks: macOS

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[macOS] DatePicker & TimePicker dont report IsFocused and use old Dat‚Ä¶" (#1820) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
‚Ä¶eTime.

### Description of Change ###

DatePicker & TimePicker are not reporting IsFocused to the Forms controls.
The DateTime being reported back is the old value. The macOS control doesnt update until after the event completes.

### Bugs Fixed ###

https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/1819

### API Changes ###

None.

### Behavioral Changes ###

None.

### PR Checklist ###

- [x] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [x] Rebased on top of master at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [x] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[macOS] DatePicker & TimePicker dont report IsFocused and use old DateTime." (#1819) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
DatePicker & TimePicker are not reporting IsFocused to the Forms controls.
The DateTime being reported back is the old value.  The macOS control doesnt update until after the event completes.

### Steps to Reproduce

-IsFocused
1. Attach to the focused event on the Forms controls.

-Old DateTime value
1. Change value and immediately check the DateTime in forms.

### Expected Behavior
-IsFocused
1. Forms control throws focus changed events.

-Old DateTime value
1. Forms control is immediately updated with the new and current value.

### Actual Behavior
-IsFocused
1. No focused events change.

-Old DateTime value
1. Old value is reported to Forms.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version: None.
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac
- Platform Target Frameworks: macOS

‚Ä¶efault to Start.

### Description of Change ###

ScrollView on macOS does not currently support Horizontal scrolling and the scrolling currently sits at the end when the Content is over drawn.

### Bugs Fixed ###

https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/1816

### API Changes ###

None.

### Behavioral Changes ###

Actual Behavior
-End Scroll
Scroll will start at the begging.

-Horizontal Scroll
No scroll available.

### PR Checklist ###

- [x] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [x] Rebased on top of master at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [x] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[macOS]  ScrollView doesnt support Horizontal Orientation and doesnt default to Start." (#1816) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
ScrollView on macOS does not currently support Horizontal scrolling and the scrolling currently sits at the end when the Content is over drawn.

### Steps to Reproduce

-End Scroll
1.  Place scroll on View, fill with a larger content.
2. Scroll will go to End.

-Horizontal Scroll
1.  Place scroll on View, set to Horizontal.
2.  No scroll.

### Expected Behavior

-End Scroll
Scroll will start at the Top or Left.

-Horizontal Scroll
Horizontal scroll will show.

### Actual Behavior

-End Scroll
Scroll will start at the begging.

-Horizontal Scroll
No scroll available.

### Basic Information

- Last known good version: None
- IDE: VS 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: macOS

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[SceneKit] Adds NullAllowed to ISCNSceneRenderer.OverlayScene" (#3410) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes xamarin/xamarin-macios#3392

It seems swift has this property listed as an optional[0] and
an Apple sample[1] sets this to null so `ISCNSceneRenderer.OverlayScene`
needs to have `[NullAllowed]` even if ObjC headers do not have
nullability information.

[0]: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/scenekit/scnscenerenderer/1524051-overlayskscene
[1]: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/3392

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump ObjectiveSharpie to a version that supports choosing its Xcode." (#3409) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Bump ObjectiveSharpie to a version that supports choosing which Xcode to use,
and also change xtro to do exactly that.

Fixes https://github.com/xamarin/maccore/issues/627.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xharness] Run xtro tests when Make.config changes." (#3408) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened issue "MTOUCH : error MT3001: Could not AOT the assembly in eShopOnContainers sample" (#3407) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Clone https://github.com/dotnet-architecture/eShopOnContainers
2. `nuget restore eShopOnContainers-iOS.sln`
3.  `msbuild eShopOnContainers-iOS.sln /p:Platform=iPhone /p:Configuration=Debug /p:MtouchArch="ARM64" /p:CodesignKey="<your key>" /p:CodesignProvision="<your dev profile>"`

### Expected Behavior
Build succeeds.

### Actual Behavior
AOT compilation fails.
```
"/Users/kylewhite/Workspace/eShopOnContainers/eShopOnContainers-iOS.sln" (default target) (1) ->
"/Users/kylewhite/Workspace/eShopOnContainers/src/Mobile/eShopOnContainers/eShopOnContainers.TestRunner.iOS/eShopOnContainers.TestRunner.iOS.csproj" (default target) (5) ->
(_CompileToNative target) ->
  MTOUCH : error MT3001: Could not AOT the assembly '/Users/kylewhite/Workspace/eShopOnContainers/src/Mobile/eShopOnContainers/eShopOnContainers.TestRunner.iOS/obj/iPhone/Debug/mtouch-cache/64/Build/eShopOnContainers.Core.dll' [/Users/kylewhite/Workspace/eShopOnContainers/src/Mobile/eShopOnContainers/eShopOnContainers.TestRunner.iOS/eShopOnContainers.TestRunner.iOS.csproj]
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[XI]WatchOS apps fail to  build with error "Undefined symbols for architecture armv7k" using XI with mono-2017-12" (#3406) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open or create a new watchOS sample
2. Build it with Release|iPhone config

### Expected Behavior
App should build successfully

### Actual Behavior
App fails to build with error: https://gist.github.com/GouriKumari/66f9a07284774f479ebea69877922ac6 .
This issue occurs only with Release|iPhone config.

### Environment

Test Env: https://gist.github.com/GouriKumari/af3f4d4338773d389c4091230574f4f8

### Build Logs
Sample: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-929e3b199cb1436cafe0172abb4f6e76.txt
Sample: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-54386a93871c4158bd7954bd60c731c9.txt
Template: https://gist.github.com/GouriKumari/f85e3aaf7d56e32b9d4701a341576700

## Example Project: https://github.com/olegoid/SubmissionSamples/tree/master/WatchOS
